metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3604 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Certificates.java in Not Yet Commons SSL before 0.3.15 does not properly verify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) field of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnot-yet-commons-ssl-java - 0.3.15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: not-yet-commons-ssl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.15-1').
